meanings.definition: The expression of thoughts and feelings through spoken words.
meanings.sent1: Her speech at the event was heartfelt and moving.
meanings.sent2: I have to give a speech in front of the whole class tomorrow.
meanings.sent3: The parrot's mimicry of human speech always makes us laugh.
meanings.sent4: His silence spoke louder than any speech could.
meanings.sent5: The power of her speech resonated with everyone in the room.

meanings.definition: A formal address or discourse delivered to an audience.
meanings.sent1: The president's speech was broadcast live on television.
meanings.sent2: I practiced my speech in front of the mirror to prepare.
meanings.sent3: The robot's malfunction led to a hilarious speech mix-up.
meanings.sent4: Her speech was a beacon of hope in a sea of despair.
meanings.sent5: The award winner's emotional speech brought tears to many eyes.

meanings.definition: The ability to speak or communicate verbally.
meanings.sent1: His speech was impaired after the accident.
meanings.sent2: Effective communication requires clear speech and active listening.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meowing almost sounded like human speech.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet of the night, the rustling leaves seemed to engage in whispered speech.
meanings.sent5: The toddler's first words marked the beginning of her journey into speech.
